notes: ui_id is the full UI tag string, e.g. '[UI: Initiation-button-1]'.
buttons include explicit render.label/style/custom_id for implementation.
channel/role components include production/testing IDs when present in source.

[UI: Welcome-video].description: Video of LT voice, explaining The Core / their role / direct them to pledge allegiance and go through the initiation process.

render.text: Welcome to The Core – it’s time to begin your official initiation Soldier..

[UI: Initiation-text-1].description: “Welcome to The Core – it’s time to begin your official initiation Soldier..”

[UI: Initiation-button-1].description: Embedded button that says “Begin Initiation” which triggers an ephemeral message.

[UI: Initiation-transitional GIF-1].description: This GIF shows glitching in the SRT screen with ‘booting’ text.

[UI: Initiation-transitional GIF-2].description: This GIF shows the charter of The Core with the ‘I Accept’ button being clicked / highlighted, then glitching.

[UI: Initiation-transitional GIF-2-back].description: This GIF shows the info text about objectives / events with ‘Back’ button being clicked / highlighted, then glitching.

[UI: Initiation-transitional GIF-3].description: This GIF shows the info text about objectives / events with ‘I Understand’ button being clicked / highlighted, then glitching.

[UI: Initiation-transitional GIF-3-back].description: This GIF shows the info text about opting into voice messages / announcements with ‘Back’ button being clicked / highlighted, then glitching.

[UI: Initiation-transitional GIF-4].description: This GIF shows the info text about opting into voice messages / announcements with ‘Yes’ button being clicked / highlighted, then glitching.

[UI: Initiation-transitional GIF-4-no].description: This GIF shows the info text about opting into voice messages / announcements with ‘No’ button being clicked / highlighted, then glitching.

[UI: Initiation-screen-charter GIF].description: This GIF shows the charter of The Core with ‘I Accept’ button on the actual screen blinking.

[UI: Initiation-screen-introduction GIF].description: This GIF details how objectives / events will be solicited to them and how to submit objectives / check-in for events with ‘I Understand’ button + ‘Back’ button on the actual screen blinking.

[UI: Initiation-screen-comms opt in GIF].description: This GIF shows text about opting into voice messages / announcements being sent via DM (must have DM’s open to server members), has Yes + No + Back buttons blinking.

[UI: Initiation-screen-congratulations G.description: This GIF shows the text ‘congratulations’ with The Core logo.

[UI: Initiation-button-2A].description: Embedded button that says “I Accept” which triggers the next update to that ephemeral message.

render.text: Our attempt to DM you has failed, please enable DMs from server members to receive audio signals. You still have been opted in.

[UI: Initiation-screen-comms opt in text.description: “Our attempt to DM you has failed, please enable DMs from server members to receive audio signals. You still have been opted in.”

[UI: Comms Opt In Success DM text].ui_id: [UI: Comms Opt In Success DM text]

render.text: Congratulations you have opted in to receive audio signals directly from LT.LICKME himself. You can always opt in or out at any time by pressing the buttons below.

[UI: Comms Opt In Success DM text].description: A direct message will be sent to the user saying “Congratulations you have opted in to receive audio signals directly from LT.LICKME himself. You can always opt in or out at any time by pressing the buttons below.”

[UI: Comms Opt Out Success DM text].ui_id: [UI: Comms Opt Out Success DM text]

render.text: You have opted out and you will no longer receive audio signals from LT.LICKME. You can always opt in or out at any time by pressing the buttons below.

[UI: Comms Opt Out Success DM text].description: A direct message will be sent to the user saying “You have opted out and you will no longer receive audio signals from LT.LICKME. You can always opt in or out at any time by pressing the buttons below.”

[UI: Discord Role The Core Signal].description: This Discord role enables audio files to be sent to those with the role through DM.

[UI: Discord Role The Core].description: This Discord role enables access to all Core text / voice channels (excluding event channels). Any mention of @The Core will tag this role.

[UI: Discord role Operator].description: This is the role of the Operators, if there is any @operators mention, this is the role that will be tagged. This Discord role is for moderators who can upload objectives / events + more.

[UI: Discord role Dishonourably Discharg.description: This is the role those who are suspended by LT’s suspend user command could receive.
This is the role those who are suspended by LT’s suspend user command could receive.
This is the role those who are suspended by LT’s suspend user command could receive.
This is the role those who are suspended by LT’s suspend user command could receive.
This is the role those who are suspended by LT’s suspend user command could receive.

render.text: In this Terminal you can access Objectives & Events with more options coming soon. Click ‘Access Terminal’ below to boot.

[UI: Terminal-access text].description: “In this Terminal you can access Objectives & Events with more options coming soon. Click ‘Access Terminal’ below to boot.”

[UI: Terminal-transitional GIF-1].description: This GIF shows glitching in the SRT screen with ‘booting’ text.

[UI: Terminal-main menu-GIF].description: This GIF shows all menu options – objectives & events, each option is blinking.

[UI: Terminal-transitional GIF-objective.description: This GIF shows menu option ‘Objectives’ highlighted, glitches.

[UI: Terminal-objectives-GIF-*objective.description: This GIF shows the first objective of the week, details name / description + merits awarded + begin / end date with buttons ‘Back’, ‘Next’, ‘Previous’, ‘Submit Objective’ blinking. This will be displayed from the specific objectives data that was uploaded, specifically the ‘GIF Upload (Main)’ section.

[UI: Terminal-transitional GIF-objective.description: This GIF shows objective name and description details but the button ‘Submit Objective’ is highlighted and glitches. This will be displayed from the specific objectives data that was uploaded, specifically the ‘GIF Upload (Submit)’ section.

This GIF shows objective name and description details but the button ‘Back’ is highlighted and glitches. This will be displayed from the specific objectives data that was uploaded, specifically the ‘GIF Upload (Back)’ section.

[UI: Terminal-objectives-GIF-submit].description: This GIF glitches then shows text detailing they have been DM’d instructions for objective submission. If they do not have DM’s enabled, adjust settings then click try again. Shows ‘Try Again’ and ‘Back’ buttons blinking.

[UI: Terminal-transitional GIF-objective.description: This GIF shows objective submit menu text explainer with option ‘Back’ highlighted, glitches.
This GIF shows objective submit menu text explainer with option ‘Try Again’ highlighted, glitches.

render.text: You have selected *Objective name + ID*. To complete this objective please input your text submission as proof of completion to be verified by the Operators – simply respond with the text in your next message to this bot and send to submit. Note: Max character limit is 250 – if you exceed this, the proof cannot be accepted.

[UI: Terminal-objectives-submit DM text-.description: Text says “You have selected *Objective name + ID*. To complete this objective please input your text submission as proof of completion to be verified by the Operators – simply respond with the text in your next message to this bot and send to submit. Note: Max character limit is 250 – if you exceed this, the proof cannot be accepted.”

render.text: You have selected *Objective name + ID*. To complete this objective please upload a photo / screenshot as proof of completion to be verified by the Operators – simply drag & drop or attach in this chat to submit. Note: Max upload file size is 8mb – if you exceed this, the proof cannot be accepted.

[UI: Terminal-objectives-submit DM text-.description: Text says “You have selected *Objective name + ID*. To complete this objective please upload a photo / screenshot as proof of completion to be verified by the Operators – simply drag & drop or attach in this chat to submit. Note: Max upload file size is 8mb – if you exceed this, the proof cannot be accepted.”

render.text: You have selected *Objective name + ID*. To complete this objective please upload a text file as proof of completion to be verified by the Operators – simply drag & drop or attach in this chat to submit. Note: Max upload file size is 8mb – if you exceed this, the proof cannot be accepted.

[UI: Terminal-objectives-submit DM text-.description: Text says “You have selected *Objective name + ID*. To complete this objective please upload a text file as proof of completion to be verified by the Operators – simply drag & drop or attach in this chat to submit. Note: Max upload file size is 8mb – if you exceed this, the proof cannot be accepted.”

render.text: You have selected *Objective name + ID*. To complete this objective please upload an audio file as proof of completion to be verified by the Operators – simply drag & drop or attach in this chat to submit. Note: Max upload file size is 8mb – if you exceed this, the proof cannot be accepted.

[UI: Terminal-objectives-submit DM text-.description: Text says “You have selected *Objective name + ID*. To complete this objective please upload an audio file as proof of completion to be verified by the Operators – simply drag & drop or attach in this chat to submit. Note: Max upload file size is 8mb – if you exceed this, the proof cannot be accepted.”

render.text: You have successfully uploaded your proof of completion of *Objective name + ID* - Operators will review your Objective promptly. Thank you for your service.

[UI: Terminal-objectives-submit DM text-.description: Text says “You have successfully uploaded your proof of completion of *Objective name + ID* - Operators will review your Objective promptly. Thank you for your service.”

render.text: Unfortunately, you uploaded the incorrect file type. Please check the file type required and upload it as proof of your Objective completion.

[UI: Terminal-objectives-submit DM text-.description: Text says “Unfortunately, you uploaded the incorrect file type. Please check the file type required and upload it as proof of your Objective completion.”

render.text: Unfortunately, the file you uploaded is too large. Please upload a file with a size of 8mb or less.

[UI: Terminal-objectives-submit DM text-.description: Text says “Unfortunately, the file you uploaded is too large. Please upload a file with a size of 8mb or less.”

render.text: Unfortunately, your text submission exceeded the 250 character limit. Please respond with your text submission with 250 characters or less.

[UI: Terminal-objectives-submit DM text-.description: Text says “Unfortunately, your text submission exceeded the 250 character limit. Please respond with your text submission with 250 characters or less.”

render.text: Submission window expired. Please enter the terminal and request submission for the Objective again.

[UI: Terminal-objectives-submit DM text-.description: Text says “Submission window expired. Please enter the terminal and request submission for the Objective again.”

render.text: You have previously submitted proof for *Objective name + ID* completion. It has not been reviewed yet, do you wish to cancel your current submission?

[UI: Terminal-objectives-submit DM text-.description: Text says “You have previously submitted proof for *Objective name + ID* completion. It has not been reviewed yet, do you wish to cancel your current submission?”

render.text: Your previous submission for *Objective name + ID* has been removed. To complete this objective please upload proof of completion to be verified by the Operators.

[UI: Terminal-objectives-resubmit DM tex.description: Text says “Your previous submission for *Objective name + ID* has been removed. To complete this objective please upload proof of completion to be verified by the Operators.”

render.text: Understood, your previous submission for *Objective name + ID* has been kept & will be reviewed by the Operators promptly.

[UI: Terminal-objectives-do not resubmit.description: Text says “Understood, your previous submission for *Objective name + ID* has been kept & will be reviewed by the Operators promptly.”

[UI: Discord channel-Objective Submissio.description: Text channel where Objective submissions are sent. Production Channel ID: 1462386608299839583 Testing Channel ID: 1450413482746056724

render.text: *Discord user ID* has just submitted *Objective name + ID* for review.

[UI: Objectives-review-user submission t.description: Text says “*Discord user ID* has just submitted *Objective name + ID* for review.”

render.text: Your submission for *Objective name + ID* has been approved by the Operators. You have been credited *Merit amount* Merits, well done Soldier – this Objective has now been completed.

[UI: Objectives-review-submission-result.description: Text says “Your submission for *Objective name + ID* has been approved by the Operators. You have been credited *Merit amount* Merits, well done Soldier – this Objective has now been completed.”

render.text: Your submission for *Objective name + ID* has been denied by the Operators. You can click ‘Submit Again’ below to try again.

[UI: Objectives-review-submission-result.description: Text says “Your submission for *Objective name + ID* has been denied by the Operators. You can click ‘Submit Again’ below to try again.”

[UI: Terminal-transitional GIF-events].description: This GIF shows menu option ‘Events’ highlighted, glitches.

[UI: Terminal-events-GIF-*event name*-ma.description: This GIF shows the first event of the week, details name / description + merits awarded with buttons ‘Check-in’, ‘Back’, ‘Next’, ‘Previous’ blinking. This will be displayed from the specific events data that was uploaded, specifically the ‘GIF Upload (Main)’ section.

[UI: Terminal-transitional GIF-events-*e.description: This GIF shows event name and description details but the button ‘Check-in’ is highlighted and glitches. This will be displayed from the specific events data that was uploaded, specifically the ‘GIF Upload (Check-in)’ section.

This GIF shows event name and description details but the button ‘Back’ is highlighted and glitches. This will be displayed from the specific events data that was uploaded, specifically the ‘GIF Upload (Back)’ section.

[UI: Terminal-events-check-in GIF].description: This GIF glitches then shows text detailing they have been DM’d instructions for check-in. If they do not have DM’s enabled, adjust settings then click try again. Shows ‘Try Again’ and ‘Back’ buttons blinking.

[UI: Terminal-transitional GIF-events-ch.description: This GIF shows menu for check-in (detailing text about DM’s) option ‘Back’ highlighted, glitches.
This GIF shows menu for check-in (detailing text about DM’s) option ‘Try Again’ highlighted, glitches.

render.text: You have checked-in to *Event name + ID*. We look forward to your attendance Soldier.

[UI: Terminal-events-check-in DM text].description: Text says “You have checked-in to *Event name + ID*. We look forward to your attendance Soldier.”

[UI: Discord Role Event X: Checked In].ui_id: [UI: Discord Role Event X: Checked In]
[UI: Discord Role Event X: Checked In].description: Dynamic role replaced by the Event role allocated during upload or edit. Could be any of the following: [UI: Discord Role Event 1 Checked In] // [UI: Discord Role Event 2 Checked In] // [UI: Discord Role Event 3 Checked In] // [UI: Discord Role Event 4 Checked In] // [UI: Discord Role Event 5 Checked In].

render.text: Welcome Operator..to Upload Objectives / Events or to view and adjust their scheduling click ‘Access Operator Terminal’ below to boot.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-access text].description: Text says “Welcome Operator..to Upload Objectives / Events or to view and adjust their scheduling click ‘Access Operator Terminal’ below to boot.”

[UI: Operator-Terminal-access-button].description: Embedded button that says “Access Operator Terminal”.

render.text: Welcome to the Operator Terminal main menu – here you can navigate to Objectives or Events to upload or manage scheduling.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-menu].description: Menu screen displaying Objective-related actions. Text says “Welcome to the Operator Terminal main menu – here you can navigate to Objectives or Events to upload or manage scheduling.”

render.text: Welcome to the Objectives submenu – here you can upload or manage scheduling of Objectives.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-menu].description: Menu screen displaying Objective-related actions. Text says “Welcome to the Objectives submenu – here you can upload or manage scheduling of Objectives.”

render.text: Welcome to the Events submenu – here you can upload or manage scheduling of Events.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-events-menu].description: Menu screen displaying Event-related actions. Text says “Welcome to the Events submenu – here you can upload or manage scheduling of Events.”

render.text: Welcome to the Commands submenu – here you can initiate a myriad of commands.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-menu].description: Menu screen displaying command initiation options. Text says “Welcome to the Commands submenu – here you can initiate a myriad of commands.”

[UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-button-r.description: Embedded button that says “Initiate Roll Call”.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-button-m.description: Embedded button that says “Initiate Merit Transfer”.

render.text: Please complete all required fields for the Objective you intend on uploading.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-upload.description: Main Objective Upload screen showing upload progress and actions. Text says “Please complete all required fields for the Objective you intend on uploading.”
Embedded button that says “Proof File Type”.

render.text: Please provide the name of the Objective below.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-upload.description: Modal prompting the Operator to enter an Objective name. Modal Text says “Please provide the name of the Objective below.”
Text input field for entering the Objective name. Input field is a text input field for user. Min length: 1 character. Max length: 64 characters. Cannot be blank.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once minimum character length is met for [UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-upload-name-modal-input-field]

render.text: Please provide the amount of Merits the Objective will award.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-upload.description: Modal prompting the Operator to enter the Merit amount awarded. Modal Text says “Please provide the amount of Merits the Objective will award.”
Numerical input field for entering Merit amount. Input field is a text (numerical only) input field for user. Min length: 1 character. Max length: 10 characters. Cannot be blank.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once minimum character length is met for [UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-upload-merits-awarded-modal-input-field]

render.text: Please select the beginning & end date for the Objective - (based in PT time zone).

[UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-upload.description: Modal prompting the Operator to select Objective begin and end dates. Modal Text says “Please select the beginning & end date for the Objective - (based in PT time zone).”

Date selector input for the Objective begin date. Text input field. Single line. Placeholder shows required format: YYYY-MM-DD. Numerical input field only. Rule: Date must be current day or in future. Rule: Date cannot be changed to a date that invalidates already selected end date. Rule: Dates are based in PT time zone. Rule: Begin date begins at 12:00am.

Date selector input for the Objective end date. Text input field. Single line. Placeholder shows required format: YYYY-MM-DD. Numerical input field only. Rule: End date must be at least 1 day beyond begin date. Rule: Dates are based in PT time zone. Rule: End date begins at 12:00am but objective expires at 11:59pm on end date.

Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once both begin & end dates have been set in [UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-upload-schedule-modal-input-field-begin-date] + [UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-upload-schedule-modal-input-field-end-date].

render.text: Please select which file type your Objective will require for proof.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-upload.description: Menu screen for selecting Objective proof file type. Text says “Please select which file type your Objective will require for proof.”
Menu screen for uploading Objective GIF assets. Text says “Please upload GIF files for all required fields for the Objective.”

render.text: These are all scheduled / active / expired Objectives – you can edit or delete them.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-schedu.description: Scheduling screen displaying existing Objectives. Text says “These are all scheduled / active / expired Objectives – you can edit or delete them.” This will also populate based on the currently displayed Objective: “*Objective name*, *status*, *begin date*, *end date*” (for current selection)

render.text: Are you sure you want to delete this Objective? This action cannot be undone.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-schedu.description: Confirmation menu for deleting an Objective. Text says “Are you sure you want to delete this Objective? This action cannot be undone.”

render.text: Edit the selected Objective – make changes below, then Submit to apply.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-schedu.description: Edit screen for the currently selected Objective in Scheduling. Text says “Edit the selected Objective – make changes below, then Submit to apply.”
Embedded button that says “Proof File Type”.

render.text: Edit the Objective name below.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-schedu.description: Modal prompting the Operator to edit the Objective name. Modal Text says “Edit the Objective name below.”

Text input field for editing the Objective name. Input field is a text input field for user. Min length: 1 character. Max length: 64 characters. Cannot be blank. Rule: Pre-filled with the current Objective name.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Rule: Submit disabled unless value differs from the pre-filled value.

render.text: Edit the Merits awarded for this Objective.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-schedu.description: Modal prompting the Operator to edit the Merit amount awarded. Modal Text says “Edit the Merits awarded for this Objective.”

Numerical input field for editing Merit amount. Input field is a text (numerical only) input field for user. Min length: 1 character. Max length: 10 characters. Cannot be blank. Rule: Pre-filled with the current Objective Merits value.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Rule: Submit disabled unless value differs from the pre-filled value.

render.text: Edit the beginning & end date for the Objective - (based in PT time zone).

[UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-schedu.description: Modal prompting the Operator to edit Objective begin and end dates. Modal Text says “Edit the beginning & end date for the Objective - (based in PT time zone).”

Date selector input for the Objective begin date. Text input field. Single line. Placeholder shows required format: YYYY-MM-DD. Numerical input field only. Rule: Pre-filled with the current Objective begin date. Rule: Date must be current day or in future. Rule: Date cannot be changed to a date that invalidates already selected end date. Rule: Dates are based in PT time zone. Rule: Begin date begins at 12:00am.

Date selector input for the Objective end date. Text input field. Single line. Placeholder shows required format: YYYY-MM-DD. Numerical input field only. Rule: Pre-filled with the current Objective end date. Rule: End date must be at least 1 day beyond begin date. Rule: Dates are based in PT time zone. Rule: End date begins at 12:00am but objective expires at 11:59pm on end date.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Rule: Submit disabled unless begin and/or end differs from pre-filled values AND both dates are valid.

render.text: Please select which file type your Objective will require for proof.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-objectives-schedu.description: Menu screen for editing Objective proof file type. Text says “Please select which file type your Objective will require for proof.”
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Rule: Submit disabled unless selection differs from the pre-selected (current) file type.
Menu screen for editing Objective GIF assets. Text says “Please upload GIF files for all required fields for the Objective.”
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Rule: Enabled only when at least one GIF slot has been updated this session (changed).

render.text: Please complete all required fields for the Event you intend on uploading.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-events-upload-men.description: Main Event Upload screen showing upload progress and actions. Text says “Please complete all required fields for the Event you intend on uploading.”

render.text: Please provide the name of the Event below.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-events-upload-nam.description: Modal prompting the Operator to enter an Event name. Modal Text says “Please provide the name of the Event below.”
Text input field for entering the Event name. Input field is a text input field for user. Min length: 1 character. Max length: 64 characters. Cannot be blank.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once minimum character length is met for [UI: Operator-Terminal-events-upload-name-modal-input-field]

render.text: Please provide the amount of Merits the Event will award.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-events-upload-mer.description: Modal prompting the Operator to enter Event Merit amount. Modal Text says “Please provide the amount of Merits the Event will award.”
Numerical input field for entering Event Merit amount. Input field is a text (numerical only) input field for user. Min length: 1 character. Max length: 10 characters. Cannot be blank.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once minimum character length is met for [UI: Operator-Terminal-events-upload-merits-awarded-modal-input-field]

render.text: Please select the beginning & end date for the Event - (based in PT time zone).

[UI: Operator-Terminal-events-upload-sch.description: Modal prompting the Operator to select Event begin and end dates. Modal Text says “Please select the beginning & end date for the Event - (based in PT time zone).”

Date selector input for the Event begin date. Text input field. Single line. Placeholder shows required format: YYYY-MM-DD. Numerical input field only. Rule: Date must be current day or in future. Rule: Date cannot be changed to a date that invalidates already selected end date. Rule: Dates are based in PT time zone. Rule: Begin date begins at 12:00am.

Date selector input for the Event end date. Text input field. Single line. Placeholder shows required format: YYYY-MM-DD. Numerical input field only. Rule: End date must be at least 1 day beyond begin date. Rule: Dates are based in PT time zone. Rule: End date begins at 12:00am but event expires at 11:59pm on end date.

Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once both begin & end dates have been set in [UI: Operator-Terminal-events-upload-schedule-modal-input-field-begin-date] + [UI: Operator-Terminal-events-upload-schedule-modal-input-field-end-date]

render.text: Please select which role your Event will allocate on check-in.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-events-upload-rol.description: Menu screen for selecting the Event role to be allocated. Text says “Please select which role your Event will allocate on check-in.”

[UI: Operator-Terminal-events-upload-GIF.description: Menu screen for editing Event GIF assets. Text says “Please upload GIF files for all required fields for the Event.”
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Rule: Enabled only when all GIF slots have been completed.

render.text: These are all scheduled / active / expired Events – you can edit or delete them.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-events-scheduling.description: Scheduling screen displaying existing Events. Text says “These are all scheduled / active / expired Events – you can edit or delete them.” This will also populate based on the currently displayed Event: “*Event name*, *status*, *begin date*, *end date*” (for current selection)

render.text: Are you sure you want to delete this Event? This action cannot be undone.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-events-scheduling.description: Confirmation menu for deleting an Event. Text says “Are you sure you want to delete this Event? This action cannot be undone.”

render.text: Edit the selected Event – make changes below, then Submit to apply.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-events-scheduling.description: Edit screen for the currently selected Event in Scheduling. Text says “Edit the selected Event – make changes below, then Submit to apply.”

render.text: Edit the Event name below.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-events-scheduling.description: Modal prompting the Operator to edit the Event name. Modal Text says “Edit the Event name below.”

Text input field for editing the Event name. Input field is a text input field for user. Min length: 1 character. Max length: 64 characters. Cannot be blank. Rule: Pre-filled with the current Event name.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Rule: Submit disabled unless value differs from the pre-filled value.

render.text: Edit the Merits awarded for this Event.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-events-scheduling.description: Modal prompting the Operator to edit the Event Merit amount. Modal Text says “Edit the Merits awarded for this Event.”

Numerical input field for editing Event Merit amount. Input field is a text (numerical only) input field for user. Min length: 1 character. Max length: 10 characters. Cannot be blank. Rule: Pre-filled with the current Event Merits value.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Rule: Submit disabled unless value differs from the pre-filled value.

render.text: Edit the beginning & end date for the Event - (based in PT time zone).

[UI: Operator-Terminal-events-scheduling.description: Modal prompting the Operator to edit Event begin and end dates. Modal Text says “Edit the beginning & end date for the Event - (based in PT time zone).”

Date selector input for the Event begin date. Text input field. Single line. Placeholder shows required format: YYYY-MM-DD. Numerical input field only. Rule: Pre-filled with the current Event begin date. Rule: Date must be current day or in future. Rule: Date cannot be changed to a date that invalidates already selected end date. Rule: Dates are based in PT time zone. Rule: Begin date begins at 12:00am.

Date selector input for the Event end date. Text input field. Single line. Placeholder shows required format: YYYY-MM-DD. Numerical input field only. Rule: Pre-filled with the current Event end date. Rule: End date must be at least 1 day beyond begin date. Rule: Dates are based in PT time zone. Rule: End date begins at 12:00am but Event expires at 11:59pm on end date.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Rule: Submit disabled unless begin and/or end differs from pre-filled values AND both dates are valid.

render.text: Please select which role your Event will allocate on check-in.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-events-scheduling.description: Menu screen for editing the Event role to be allocated. Text says “Please select which role your Event will allocate on check-in.”
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Rule: Submit disabled unless selection differs from the pre-selected role mapping for this Event.
Menu screen for editing Event GIF assets. Text says “Please upload GIF files for all required fields for the Event.”
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Rule: Enabled only when at least one GIF slot has been updated this session (changed).

render.text: Please complete all required fields for the Roll Call you intend to initiate.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-initiate.description: Roll Call command setup screen. Text says “Please complete all required fields for the Roll Call you intend to initiate.”

render.text: Please select which channel the Roll Call will take place in – remembering Event check-in roles are paired with the corresponding text channel (Event 1:Check-in role = Channel 1 text channel).

[UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-initiate.description: Menu screen for selecting the Roll Call target channel. Text says “Please select which channel the Roll Call will take place in – remembering Event check-in roles are paired with the corresponding text channel (Event 1:Check-in role = Channel 1 text channel).”

render.text: Please react with the white_check_mark: emoji to confirm your attendance to this event & secure your Merits.

[UI: Roll-Call message].description: System-generated Roll Call message posted to the selected channel. Text says “Please react with the white_check_mark: emoji to confirm your attendance to this event & secure your Merits.”

render.text: You have successfully confirmed your attendance at *event name + ID* and you have been credited *merit amount* Merits. Well done, Soldier.

[UI: Terminal-events-attend-success DM t.description: Text sent to a user confirming event attendance and Merit award. Text says “You have successfully confirmed your attendance at *event name + ID* and you have been credited *merit amount* Merits. Well done, Soldier.”

render.text: Please complete all required fields for the Announcement you intend to initiate.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-initiate.description: Announcement command setup screen. Text says “Please complete all required fields for the Announcement you intend to initiate.”

render.text: Please upload the announcement file.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-initiate.description: Announcement audio upload screen. Text says “Please upload the announcement file.”

render.text: Operator @*Discord user ID* has just submitted an Announcement for review.

[UI: Announcement Initiation Request tex.description: Text says “Operator @*Discord user ID* has just submitted an Announcement for review.” This message will also include the audio file the operator uploaded in their announcement upload.

render.text: You have received a new signal from LT.LICKME..

[UI: Announcement-text DM].description: Text says “You have received a new signal from LT.LICKME..”

render.text: Please complete all required fields for the Merit Transfer you intend to initiate.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-initiate.description: Merit Transfer command setup screen. Text says “Please complete all required fields for the Merit Transfer you intend to initiate.”

render.text: Please provide the Discord ID of the user you wish to initiate a Merit transfer to.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-initiate.description: Modal prompting the Operator to enter a User ID. Modal Text says “Please provide the Discord ID of the user you wish to initiate a Merit transfer to.”
Text input field for entering a Discord User ID. Must be a valid Discord snowflake. Min length: 1 character. Cannot be blank.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once minimum character length is met for [UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-initiate-merit-transfer-user-id-modal-input-field]

render.text: Please provide the amount of Merits you wish to transfer.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-initiate.description: Modal prompting the Operator to enter a Merit amount. Modal Text says “Please provide the amount of Merits you wish to transfer.”

Numerical input field for entering Merit amount. Input field is a text (numerical only) input field for user. Min length: 1 character. Max length: 4 characters. Cannot be blank. Integer only, range 1-9999. Leading zeros are allowed but normalized.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once minimum character length is met for [UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-initiate-merit-transfer-transfer-amount-modal-input-field]

render.text: Please provide context on why you are initiating this Merit transfer.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-initiate.description: Modal prompting the Operator to enter notes for the transfer. Modal Text says “Please provide context on why you are initiating this Merit transfer.”
Text input field for entering Operator notes. Min length: 5 characters. Max length: 1,000 characters. Cannot be blank.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once minimum character length is met for [UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-initiate-merit-transfer-operator-notes-modal-input-field]

render.text: Operator @*Discord user ID* has just submitted a Merit Transfer for review. *Merit amount* will be sent to @*Discord user ID*.

[UI: Merit-Transfer Initiation Request t.description: Text says “Operator @*Discord user ID* has just submitted a Merit Transfer for review. *Merit amount* will be sent to @*Discord user ID*.” 1st Discord ID is Operator, 2nd Discord ID is the user who is receiving the Merits.

render.text: You have just received *Merit amount* Merits from an Operator.

[UI: Merit-Transfer Success DM text].description: Text says “You have just received *Merit amount* Merits from an Operator.”

render.text: Welcome LT. Use the Terminal below to Adjust Merits or Suspend Users.

[UI: LT-Terminal-access text].description: Text says “Welcome LT. Use the Terminal below to Adjust Merits or Suspend Users.”

[UI: LT-Terminal-access-button].description: Embedded button that says “Access LT Terminal”.

render.text: Please select either option, Adjust Merits – to add or deduct Merits // Suspend User – to dishonourably discharge a Soldier.

[UI: LT-Terminal-menu].description: Menu screen displaying LT Terminal menu options. Text says “Please select either option, Adjust Merits – to add or deduct Merits // Suspend User – to dishonourably discharge a Soldier.”

render.text: Please select if you would like to Add or Deduct Merits.

[UI: LT-Terminal-adjust-merits-menu].description: Menu screen displaying Merit adjustment options. Text says “Please select if you would like to Add or Deduct Merits.”

render.text: Please complete all required fields for the Add Merits command you intend to initiate.

[UI: LT-Terminal-adjust-merits-add-merit.description: Add Merits command setup screen. Text says “Please complete all required fields for the Add Merits command you intend to initiate.”

render.text: Please provide the Discord ID of the user you wish to initiate an Add Merits transfer to.

[UI: LT-Terminal-adjust-merits-add-merit.description: Modal prompting LT to enter a User ID. Modal Text says “Please provide the Discord ID of the user you wish to initiate an Add Merits transfer to.”
Text input field for entering a Discord User ID. Must be a valid Discord snowflake. Cannot be blank.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once minimum character length is met for [UI: LT-Terminal-adjust-merits-add-merits-user-id-modal-input-field]

render.text: Please provide the amount of Merits you wish to Add to the user.

[UI: LT-Terminal-adjust-merits-add-merit.description: Modal prompting LT to enter the number of Merits to add. Modal Text says “Please provide the amount of Merits you wish to Add to the user.”

Numerical input field for entering the Merit amount. Input field is a text (numerical only) input field for user. Min length: 1 character. Max length: 5 characters. Cannot be blank. Integer only, range 1-99999. Leading zeros are allowed but normalized.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once minimum character length is met for [UI: LT-Terminal-adjust-merits-add-merits-transfer-amount-modal-input-field]

render.text: Please provide context on why you are initiating this Merit transfer.

[UI: LT-Terminal-adjust-merits-add-merit.description: Modal prompting LT to enter notes for the Merit addition. Modal Text says “Please provide context on why you are initiating this Merit transfer.”
Text input field for entering LT notes. Min length: 5 characters. Max length: 1,000 characters. Cannot be blank.

render.text: You have just received *Merit amount* Merits from LT himself, lucky you..

[UI: LT Add Merit-Transfer Success text].description: Text says “You have just received *Merit amount* Merits from LT himself, lucky you..”

render.text: Please complete all required fields for the Deduct Merits command you intend to initiate.

[UI: LT-Terminal-adjust-merits-deduct-me.description: Deduct Merits command setup screen. “Please complete all required fields for the Deduct Merits command you intend to initiate.”

render.text: Please provide the Discord ID of the user you wish to initiate a Deduct Merits transfer from.

[UI: LT-Terminal-adjust-merits-deduct-me.description: Modal prompting LT to enter a User ID. Modal Text says “Please provide the Discord ID of the user you wish to initiate a Deduct Merits transfer from.”
Text input field for entering a Discord User ID. Must be a valid Discord snowflake. Cannot be blank.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once minimum character length is met for [UI: LT-Terminal-adjust-merits-deduct-merits-user-id-modal-input-field]

render.text: Please provide the amount of Merits you wish to Deduct from the user.

[UI: LT-Terminal-adjust-merits-deduct-me.description: Modal prompting LT to enter the number of Merits to deduct. Modal Text says “Please provide the amount of Merits you wish to Deduct from the user.”

Numerical input field for entering the Merit amount. Input field is a text (numerical only) input field for user. Min length: 1 character. Max length: 5 characters. Cannot be blank. Integer only, range 1-99999. Leading zeros are allowed but normalized.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once minimum character length is met for [UI: LT-Terminal-adjust-merits-deduct-merits-transfer-amount-modal-input-field]

render.text: Please provide context on why you are initiating this Merit deduction.

[UI: LT-Terminal-adjust-merits-deduct-me.description: Modal prompting LT to enter notes for the Merit deduction. Modal Text says “Please provide context on why you are initiating this Merit deduction.”
Text input field for entering LT notes. Min length: 5 characters. Max length: 1,000 characters. Cannot be blank.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once minimum character length is met for [UI: LT-Terminal-adjust-merits-deduct-merits-lt-notes-modal-input-field]

render.text: You have just been deducted *Merit amount* Merits by LT himself..

[UI: LT Deduct Merit-Transfer Success te.description: Text says “You have just been deducted *Merit amount* Merits by LT himself..”

render.text: Please complete all required fields for the Suspend User command you intend to initiate.

[UI: LT-Terminal-suspend-user-menu].description: Suspend User command setup screen. “Please complete all required fields for the Suspend User command you intend to initiate.”

render.text: Please provide the Discord ID of the user you wish to suspend.

[UI: LT-Terminal-suspend-user-user-id-mo.description: Modal prompting LT to enter a User ID. Modal Text says “Please provide the Discord ID of the user you wish to suspend.”
Text input field for entering a Discord User ID. Must be a valid Discord snowflake. Cannot be blank.
Embedded button that says “Submit”. Button only enabled once minimum character length is met for [UI: LT-Terminal-suspend-user-user-id-modal-input-field]

render.text: Please select the duration of the suspension.

[UI: LT-Terminal-suspend-user-duration-m.description: Menu screen for selecting suspension duration. “Please select the duration of the suspension.”

render.text: Unfortunately you have been dishonourably discharged from The Core for *duration*. Your access has been revoked until this period is up, take this time to consider your motivations to our collective cause. If you need clarity on why this suspension occurred, reach out to an Operator through the general chat in the Discord.

[UI: Suspension text].description: Text sent via DM to the suspended user notifying them of their suspension and duration. Text says “Unfortunately you have been dishonourably discharged from The Core for *duration*. Your access has been revoked until this period is up, take this time to consider your motivations to our collective cause. If you need clarity on why this suspension occurred, reach out to an Operator through the general chat in the Discord.”

render.text: The official rankings of The Core – see where your services resides. Click ‘Access Leaderboard’ below to boot.

[UI: Leaderboard-access text].description: “The official rankings of The Core – see where your services resides. Click ‘Access Leaderboard’ below to boot.”

[UI: Leaderboard-current-cycle].description: Displaying the top 25 Discord User ID’s from the current 90 day cycle along with their Merits as a table + includes users personal score at the bottom: ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════

[UI: Leaderboard-all-time].description: Displaying the top 25 Discord User ID’s of all time along with their Merits as a table + includes users personal score at the bottom: ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════

[UI: Leaderboard-top 3-announcement-text.description: Text says “Congratulations to our top performing Soldiers of this cycle – our ‘Chosen’. You have served LT.LICKME and represented The Core with honour. You will be contacted by the @Operators to organize shipment of your Black Boxes – The Core commends you. #1 *@Discord ID* #2 *@Discord ID* #3 *@Discord ID* @The Core” The top 3 discord ID’s will be sourced from the current cycle leaderboard.

[UI: Operator-Terminal-commands-initiate.description: Embedded button that says “Submit”. Enabled only when all fields are valid.
